Dialog.Caption: Emulation
Dialog.DialogHelp: An emulation makes SlickEdit work like another editor, mimicking common key bindings and behaviors. Changing the emulation will affect things like cursor movement, selection style, and other editor behaviors. If you are not sure which emulation to choose, we recommend using the default emulation, CUA.

Dialog.Caption: Colors
Dialog.DialogHelp: Select a color scheme for SlickEdit. Both light and dark backgrounds schemes are provided.

Dialog.Caption: Fonts
Dialog.DialogHelp: Select the font to use for Unicode and Non-Unicode editor windows. Unicode editor windows display characters using UTF, commonly used for XML, or EBCIDIC. Non-Unicode windows display regular text using Single Byte Character Sets (SBCS) or Double Byte Character Sets (DBCS).

Dialog.Caption: Coding
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options control the look of your code as well as how your editor behaves while you type. Syntax Expansion and Line Numbers are controlled by tri-state checkboxes. Checked will turn the option on for all languages. Unchecked turns it off for all languages. Grayed in means no change, and the individual language settings will be retained.

Dialog.Caption: Associate File Types
Dialog.DialogHelp: Select which file types should automatically load in SlickEdit when opened from within Windows Explorer.

Dialog.Caption: Context Tagging
Dialog.DialogHelp: Select the compiler tag files you would like SlickEdit to begin build for future use. The tag files will be built in the background.
